revised_title: On the Development of Teeth in Newts, Frogs, Slowworms, and Green Lizards
tldr: The author examines the development of teeth in newts, frogs, slowworms, and green lizards, finding that the process occurs beneath the surface and involves the enamel-organ and tooth-sacs. The study contributes to the understanding of tooth development in various species and sheds light on the differences between their dental structures.
